game_description: FREEDIVER: Triton Down plunges you into a capsizing research ship, the Triton, where survival means outmaneuvering the water's lethal surge. As world-class diver Ren Tanaka, you must freedive through a sinking ship, overcome underwater chaos, and unlock your path to the surface, all while protecting your most precious resource: the breath in your lungs. Reworked for Oculus® Quest, the FREEDIVER: Triton Down Extended Cut now boasts a deeper story, expanded gameplay areas, and all-new ways to explore them. Underwater Adventure Survive a harrowing nautical disaster as a world-class freediver Fight for Breath Oxygen is your only resource, the rising seawater your greatest adversary Gestural Locomotion Navigate virtual spaces with intuitive dive and swim movement Interactive Puzzles Stay calm, think fast, and use your environment to escape Immersive Soundscapes Handcrafted music and SFX from an award-winning audio team
review_1: The game was fun to play and it actually somewhat felt like I was swimming. The only thing I didn't like was that it was very short. It would be cool if there was some type of just exploration mode where you could swim around a beach or something. Very good though.
review_2: This game is so fun and worth the money. I just wish it didn’t end on a cliffhanger.
review_3: I like this game a lot because of the fact that you swim the whole time! I know no other swimming games on vr, and I don't think any of them are as cool as this one. I would ask the developer only one thing: I would really like it if I could skip the first part of the game. The action and adventure doesn't really start until after you get the two keys and discover the magical creature. I found this part of the game not very exciting and whenever I want to replay this game I have to go through this long part again and I just wish there was something like a chapter select so I could skip it and go straight to the part where the ship is sinking. But I still enjoy this game and I love the intensity of running out of breath and searching for oxygen. This is a fun game whenever I feel like swimming but don't want to go to the pool.
review_4: I bought this game yesterday and finished the day after...far too short and so not worth the money. I was enjoying it . But time limit very disappointing.
review_5: It's OK but it ended to quickly
